meanings.definition: Belief in the existence of individual spirits that inhabit natural objects and phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The tribe's animistic beliefs led them to worship the spirits of trees and rivers.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient cultures held animistic beliefs about the world around them.
meanings.sent3: The animistic spirits of the mountains were said to play pranks on unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: Her animistic worldview made her see a soul in every rock and stream.
meanings.sent5: The animistic belief in nature's spirits was deeply ingrained in their culture.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the belief in spirits inhabiting natural objects.
meanings.sent1: The animistic rituals honored the spirits believed to dwell in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The animistic tradition of the tribe involved offerings to the spirits of the land.
meanings.sent3: The animistic connection between humans and nature was celebrated during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His animistic perspective allowed him to see the world as a living, breathing entity.
meanings.sent5: The animistic worldview sees the world as a place where spirits reside in all things.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the attribution of a soul to plants, inanimate objects, and natural phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The animistic culture believed that even rocks and rivers possessed souls.
meanings.sent2: An animistic approach to life sees everything as interconnected and alive.
meanings.sent3: The animistic view of the world made even the wind seem like a playful spirit.
meanings.sent4: In her animistic mindset, the stars were not just lights but souls watching over us.
meanings.sent5: The animistic belief system imbued every aspect of nature with a sense of vitality.
